title: "Fuel for Life" type in Diesel commercial
content:
Diesel is running a “Fuel for Life” campaign and at the end of this specific commercial there is a graphic on the left that say “FUEL for LIFE”. Does anyone know what serif font FUEL and LIFE is and even more importantly what the “for” is (if it isn’t the same). See the commercial on YouTube at [http://youtube.com/watch?v=omIUXWvmCYU](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102222347/http:/youtube.com/watch?v=omIUXWvmCYU "http://youtube.com/watch?v=omIUXWvmCYU")

 [‹ (x) "Brightest" stencil serif face - Le Corbusier {Angel}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102222347/http:/typophile.com/node/38529 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Pain is weakness leaving the body" rough brush script - Edo {Mike F} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102222347/http:/typophile.com/node/38502 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Ogred Weary

comments.content: YouTube’s quality is so poor it’s difficult to make out the type, but “FUEL” and “LIFE” might be a [Baskerville](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102222347/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=baskerville&sample_text=FUEL%20LIFE&sample_size=60).
